data.fullContent: Christopher Street Liberation Day on June 28, 1970 marked the first anniversary of the Stonewall riots with an assembly on Christopher Street; with simultaneous Gay Pride marches in Los Angeles and Chicago, these were the first Gay Pride marches in U.S. history. The next year, Gay Pride marches took place in Boston, Dallas, Milwaukee, London, Paris, West Berlin, and Stockholm. The New York Times reported ( on the front page ) that the marchers took up the entire street for about 15 city blocks. Reporting by The Village Voice was positive, describing "the out-front resistance that grew out of the police raid on the Stonewall Inn one year ago".
data.answer: 1970年6月28日克里斯托弗街解放日，石墙暴动一周年，人们在克里斯托弗街举行集会。洛杉矶和芝加哥同时举行了同性恋游行，这是美国历史上第一次同性恋游行。第二年，同性恋游行在波士顿、达拉斯、密尔沃基、伦敦、巴黎、西柏林和斯德哥尔摩举行。《纽约时报》(在头版)报道称，游行者占据了大约15个街区的整条街道。《乡村之声》(The Village Voice)的报道是积极的，描述了“大众对于一年前警察突袭石墙酒店(Stonewall Inn)的反抗”。
